course_title: Practical Lawyering Skills: Transactional Drafting Practicum
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 7Waitlist Total: 0 of 5
course_description: As a "student attorney" in this course; you will have the opportunity to provide legal services to businesses and non-profit clients in a real-world setting. This advanced course will use and build upon the foundational legal principles of Contract law, Business law, Property law (real & intellectual), and Ethics to provide a real transactional lawyering experience. Under our supervision and in small groups of 3 or 4, we will work with non-profit and small businesses on various agreements.
prerequisites: LAW 500X and 520 and 659A or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisites.
sections: Class Nbr: 5243, Section #: 01, Type: PRA, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 6-7:30p, Instructor: Norman/Gilmore, Status: Open
